I don't like it when gays face harassment either, but there's ne less of a need for 'the facts' and the 'circumstances' when gays are attacked than in this case.
 
 Whether they like it or not, reverse prejudice is STILL prejudice.
 
 
You claim you want all the "facts" (never needed until now) and I agree it would be nice to have more information on the situation but the article at its very least gives us something to look at. 

 
 If 'facts' were really important to him, he'd be consistently skeptical and ask for them even when gays are attacked.
foundit66

Why attack the article?

 You know what's really funny?
 I explained EXPLICITLY why I thought the article was XXXX, and you just ignored ALL of that and asked that stupid question.
 
 And then, you proceeded to pretend to answer your question with issues I never even broached. I never said that it was wrong because Fox News wrote it.
 
 If you really want an answer to your question, GO BACK AND READ what I said and ADDRESS what I said.
 
 Your question has been answered, but you don't want to listen to the answer...
 
 
 
You claim you want all the "facts" (never needed until now) and I agree it would be nice to have more information on the situation but the article at its very least gives us something to look at.

 Give me ANY other article where we had such a ridiculously shoddy portrayal of the situation that it could have changed the outcome of a judgment.
 
 I admit we have had other articles in the past where some of the facts were missing, but I can't think of ANY that were this bad or that could have switched the viewing based on the facts withheld.
 
 
 
I don't think article intended to do anything more than report on a series of complaints...not investigate them as if this were a court case. As I said though, I would like to see some follow up articles with some more details. 

 That's funny.
 A "series of complaints", but we blame the gay people for the dog pooh.
 I'm betting NONE of these are filed with police reports.
 
 
 
But until then, can't you talk about the claims in the article? What if they all are true? What would you say to this?

 Again, steeeeeve, READ what I said.
 I have already addressed this.
 
 READ what I wrote and stop trying your damndest to misrepresent me.
foundit66

And the really odd thing is, when public namecalling takes place against gays, it's usually called harassment and hatred. When it could possibly be prejudice and hatred on the part of gays doing these things, suddenly they're wanting "circumstances" as if they ask for the "circumstances" when a gay person is the victim. Suddenly they're saying things like "we don't know"! Why don't they say things like that when the shoe is on the other foot???? It's ridiculous. I don't like it when gays face harassment either, but there's ne less of a need for 'the facts' and the 'circumstances' when gays are attacked than in this case.

 Jyoshu, it comes down to the usual way things play out...
 When a gay person is harassed in public, there is typically NO precursor to the situation. Take the recent attacks in San Diego for example.
 The anti-gay prejudice doesn't need "circumstances".
 
 On the other hand, I have NEVER heard of any of this type of XXXX. I don't think I know ANYBODY who uses the term "breeder", except now I guess for possibly Matthew.
 
 
 
If 'facts' were really important to him, he'd be consistently skeptical and ask for them even when gays are attacked.

 Gee Jyoshu.
 
 You never addressed the issue of HOW THAT APPLIES TO YOU.
 I've already stated NUMEROUS times that I want more of the story because I am skeptical. But if the story is precisely how they described, then I stated that it was wrong.
 
 But for you, HOW MANY TIMES have you demanded that we need to know more, and here when we have LESS INFORMATION THAN USUAL, you are silent on that type of demand????
 
 Jyoshu. You're a pot calling the kettle black.
jyoshu

Jyoshu, it comes down to the usual way things play out...
 When a gay person is harassed in public, there is typically NO precursor to the situation. Take the recent attacks in San Diego for example.
 The anti-gay prejudice doesn't need "circumstances".

 
 Why do you assume that the website itself was not the precursor/catalyst to the events of the article? The way I interpret your posts here on this is that you suspect something happened between the straight people and the gays behind all these instances in the article that we don't know about, that 'set the gays off' or whatever. (Corect me if I'm wrong.) If you want to find a catalyst, I see no reason the website itself was not the catalyst by giving these gay people the names. 
 
 
On the other hand, I have NEVER heard of any of this type of XXXX. I don't think I know ANYBODY who uses the term "breeder"

 
 Well now you have.
 
 And the rest of your post wasn't addressing the article but was a personal statement about me, and as such doesn't deserve a response.
foundit66

Why do you assume that the website itself was not the precursor/catalyst to the events of the article?

 There are NO facts in evidence to intimate that it was...
 
 
 
The way I interpret your posts ....

 I always shudder when I read you saying that.
 It usually means you're about to undertake a thorough misrepresentation of what I ACTUALLY said...
 
 
 
The way I interpret your posts here on this is that you suspect something happened between the straight people and the gays behind all these instances in the article that we don't know about, that 'set the gays off' or whatever. (Corect me if I'm wrong.)

 0) That is one obvious possibility... But looking at the specifics.
 1) "taunting breeders": If it happened, it was probably wrong.
 2) *one woman called a bigot*: It's not just an issue of "setting the gays off", but rather an issue of context. It seems like there was a discussion here, and the question remains as to the circumstances of the case. Not just antissue of "setting the gays off", but the discussion before-hand and if these two actually knew each other.
 3) *dog poo*
 I am completely underwhelmed by the fact that you and Steeeeve keep avoiding this example like it's the plague. Neither of you have commented on the fact that there is NO STATED REASON for any implication that gays are responsible. Yet the article clearly makes that implication.
 Is that bigotry to assume a gay guy did it?
 You two will just whine about the question, but never address it.
 
 
 
The way I interpret your posts If you want to find a catalyst, I see no reason the website itself was not the catalyst by giving these gay people the names. 

 I see no reason the website itself was the catalyst by giving these gay people the names.
 The web-site was never even mentioned in these incidents.
 
 
 
The way I interpret your posts And the rest of your post wasn't addressing the article but was a personal statement about me, and as such doesn't deserve a response.

 ROFLMAO!
 It was a "personal statement about you" responding to YOU MAKING A PERSONAL STATEMENT ABOUT ME...
 
 And you tried that tactic not just once, but TWICE.
 And NOW you don't want to address "personal statements"...
 
 So I guess when you're making observations on others, that's fine...
 But when others REPLY to your observations on them by pointing out how YOUR ANALYSIS APPLIES TO YOU, that is when you want to avoid "personal statements".
 
 If you don't think others see this ploy for what it is, you're blind.
Steeeeve

I never said that it was wrong because Fox News wrote it.
 You coulda fooled me. What about those comments early in this thread about the eggs being thrown at you and how Fox News would do nothing about it? Just a random point you decided to bring up I suppose....I think you just didn't realize it wasn't Fox News until I pointed it out to you now.
 
 
Again, steeeeeve, READ what I said.
 I have already addressed this.
 You did briefly address this and I apologize for not remember as it was at the beginning. You said "it would be wrong if true"...or something like that.
 
 
Give me ANY other article where we had such a ridiculously shoddy portrayal of the situation that it could have changed the outcome of a judgment.
 
 I admit we have had other articles in the past where some of the facts were missing, but I can't think of ANY that were this bad or that could have switched the viewing based on the facts withheld.
I'm not gonna dig up stuff just to please you but atleast you can admit there are some articles "from the other side" that have been low on details.
 
 
I explained EXPLICITLY why I thought the article was XXXX, and you just ignored ALL of that and asked that stupid question.
 I didn't ignore anything. I just think you expect more from the article than what really needs to be there. 
 
 I guess a further point is, if this stuff does turn out to be true, would this change your opinions on the list? What if the problem got worse?
foundit66

You coulda fooled me. What about those comments early in this thread about the eggs being thrown at you and how Fox News would do nothing about it? Just a random point you decided to bring up I suppose....I think you just didn't realize it wasn't Fox News until I pointed it out to you now.

 Actually, it was a side-point that you're trying to turn into the main attraction to avoid addressing my main points. A side-point both on how gays are ACTUALLY harassed on a basis that goes unreported, and on my skepticism over Fox News. SIDE-point. Not the main attraction at all.
 And I did realize it was Fox News when I clicked on your link to give the quote from the article that I put up three pages back.
 
 
 
I'm not gonna dig up stuff just to please you but atleast you can admit there are some articles "from the other side" that have been low on details.

 Actually, I was asking WHICH articles were low enough on details where simple things could dramatically change the story subtext.
 A question which goes unaddressed.
 
 
 
I didn't ignore anything. I just think you expect more from the article than what really needs to be there.

 I can't think of ANY article put up by the pro-gay side which was this shoddy on details.
 And if THAT is all you're expecting, then quite frankly your expectations are too low in my opinion.
 
 
 
I guess a further point is, if this stuff does turn out to be true, would this change your opinions on the list? What if the problem got worse?

 And this would be a perfect example of shoddiness on the article.
 The ONLY thing concrete it mentions that is about the "list" is the list on the windshield. That's it.
 ONE actual instance that can be tied to that list.
 
 But regardless, what ACTUAL CRIMINALLY PROSECUTABLE CHARGE can be levelled here? Dog feces that was probably left by a dog would be littering possibly.
 
 If something ACTUALLY CRIMINAL happened, that might make it something else.
 But until then, you can't use the fact that others are using their first amendment right to free speech as a reason to stop the list.
foundit66

Incidentally, regarding my comments on "Fox News" reporting me having an egg thrown at me twice while in the gay part of San Diego...
 
 I searched Fox News for any mention of the hate crime committed at the San Diego gay pride held there recently. Fox News had NO ARTICLE on it...
 http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/metro/20060802-9999-7m2gayhate.html
 
 Six men were assaulted.
 One has a fractured skull and had to have a tracheotomy to help him breathe.
 One of them was stabbed.
 
 Yet Fox news concentrates on women finding dog XXXX next to their car who thinks it must have been them damn gays instead of reporting ACTUAL ASSAULTS committed out of hate.
 
 My point on Fox News was valid, even if it wasn't my main one.
 And I can't help but notice that nobody is arguing against the VALIDITY of my comment, but instead just complaining that I made it...
Steeeeve

And this would be a perfect example of shoddiness on the article.
 The ONLY thing concrete it mentions that is about the "list" is the list on the windshield. That's it.
 ONE actual instance that can be tied to that list.
 
 But regardless, what ACTUAL CRIMINALLY PROSECUTABLE CHARGE can be levelled here? Dog feces that was probably left by a dog would be littering possibly.
 
 If something ACTUALLY CRIMINAL happened, that might make it something else.
 But until then, you can't use the fact that others are using their first amendment right to free speech as a reason to stop the list.
 
 At this point I could cry out "you are lying and misrepresenting me"....but I don't wish take this cheap and immature tactic as I am sure you just misunderstood me and my question.
 
 My question was if the claims are true what would your thoughts be? Not if they are true do you think these people go to jail. I suspect you would support people yelling "bigot" to random people they found from a list but please correct me if I suspect wrong.
Steeeeve

Incidentally, regarding my comments on "Fox News" reporting me having an egg thrown at me twice while in the gay part of San Diego...
 
 I searched Fox News for any mention of the hate crime committed at the San Diego gay pride held there recently. Fox News had NO ARTICLE on it...
 http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/metro/20060802-9999-7m2gayhate.html
 
 Six men were assaulted.
 One has a fractured skull and had to have a tracheotomy to help him breathe.
 One of them was stabbed.
 
 Yet Fox news concentrates on women finding dog XXXX next to their car who thinks it must have been them damn gays instead of reporting ACTUAL ASSAULTS committed out of hate.
 
 My point on Fox News was valid, even if it wasn't my main one.
 And I can't help but notice that nobody is arguing against the VALIDITY of my comment, but instead just complaining that I made it...

 Once again Fox News didn't write the article, the AP did and was reported in many newspapers. If you want me to attack the validity of your comment I will...
 
 I didn't see anyone from NBC, CNN, ABC, LA Times, or Chicago Tribune have an article about the San Diego Gay Pride parade. They must be just as bad in your book emoticon_rolleyes
foundit66

Once again Fox News didn't write the article, the AP did and was reported in many newspapers. If you want me to attack the validity of your comment I will...
 I didn't see anyone from NBC, CNN, ABC, LA Times, or Chicago Tribune have an article about the San Diego Gay Pride parade. They must be just as bad in your book emoticon_rolleyes

 
 CNN had no article on either the gay pride assault, or the "Cape Cod" article. Thus, consistent.
 
 NBC covered the "Cape Cod" article, but they ALSO picked up the Gay Pride parade assault, despite your inaccurate claims.
 http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/14125346/
 
 ABC news didn't cover either article. Thus, consistent.
 
 The LA Times covered both the "Cape Cod" article and the Gay Pride assault story, again despite your inaccurate claims.
 (Did you just decide to throw out a claim without actually checking?
 Is that a usual M.O. for you?)
 
 The Chicago Tribune is like the Fox News situation. They printed the "Cape Cod" article, but not the article regarding the San Diego hate crime. So yes. I would possibly lump them in a similar boat.
 
 
 It should now be noted that I did find Fox News LOCAL SAN DIEGO channel did report on the anti-gay hate crime. Amusingly enough, it got less print space than the "Cape Cod" report.
 So, to put it in perspective, there is more print used for anonymous claims of completely legal taunts of "breeders" and one woman being called a "bigot" and another person finding dog poo next to her car...
 ... than there is for SIX ASSAULTS by multiple, organized perpetrators, where one victim wound up with a fractured skull.
 emoticon_xgood
